Description: Upper body fragment of East Greek pottery closed vessel; goat browsing goat to right, its middle part preserved. In the field, various filling ornament; above, band of glaze. Clay micaceous.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 7, no. 15 pl. 4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.904)
